title: Multi-Record Information Extraction from Web Pages
author: Alexander Kustenkov (Ivannikov Institute for System Programming of the Russian Academy of Sciences), Maksim Varlamov (Ivannikov Institute for System Programming of the Russian Academy of Sciences), Alexander Yatskov (Ivannikov Institute for System Programming of the Russian Academy of Sciences), ..., Alexander Yatskov (Lomonosov Moscow State University)
relevance_why: The proposed methods for extracting information from web pages could be adapted for audio-related tasks, such as cataloging and retrieving audio samples based on attributes extracted from associated web content.
background: Extracting structured data from web pages with multiple entries, such as news articles that list several items, to enable better data organization and retrieval.
contribution: This paper introduces a large-scale dataset for extracting information from multi-record web pages using neural network methods, achieving improved extraction accuracy with MarkupLM.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily targeted single-record or detailed pages; extraction from list pages was less explored.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes a novel multi-stage approach that applies MarkupLM for efficient extraction from multi-record formats without relying on visual representations.

key_innovation: The proposed methods leverage MLS capabilities to handle the complexities of HTML structure for multi-record data extraction.
real_world_impact: This research provides a valuable resource for enhancing web data extraction methods, potentially benefiting numerous applications in data retrieval, including audio data sourcing and organization.
limitations: No significant limitations were explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.MarkupLM: **Markup Language Model** is a deep learning architecture designed to process structured documents like HTML, focusing on understanding the markup's semantic and positional context for better data extraction.

open_sourcing: The dataset and methods will be made publicly available at https://github.com/ispras/news-page-dataset
